creator: hostmaster@esknet.ee
text:
I have compiled 2.0.36 release of httpd Apache, and installed it on the server.
http requests work properly, but when I type in browser https://194.204.62.58/
it will say Cannot find page.

PS. I have changed back the string in mod_cgi.h
from #include "mod_include.h"
to #include "../filters/mod_include.h"

creator: hostmaster@esknet.ee
text: Have tested this on httpd-2.0.35 and on yesterdays cvs, the result was the same.

creator: rbb@apache.org
text: Please provide the portion of your configuration file for your SSL virtual host.

Default config, only changed fields:
---httpd.conf---
Group nobody
---httpd.conf---
---ssl.conf---
ServerName www.esknet.ee:443
ServerAdmin hostmaster@esknet.ee
---ssl.conf---
all documents are placed in default configured folders.
creator: hostmaster@esknet.ee

text:
[This is a mass bug update.]
This bug reports a problem in an older version of Apache 2.
Could you please update to the most recent version and see
if you can reproduce this problem.  If the bug still exists,
please update the bug with the latest version number.  If 
the bug no longer exists, please close the bug report.

Sorry for this impersonal response, but we get many more bug
reports than our volunteers can keep up with.
Thanks for using Apache!
creator: slive@apache.org
hostmaster@esknet.ee
text:
I have just installed version 2.0.43
The result is the same.

creator: Kenneth.Lerman@se-ltd.com
text:
I also have the bug.

I have just installed version 2.0.44
The result is the same.

Logging with debug shows (in relevant part):
[Mon Jan 20 17:51:48 2003] [debug] ssl_engine_kernel.c(1766): OpenSSL: Loop: 
SSLv3 flush data
[Mon Jan 20 17:51:48 2003] [debug] ssl_engine_kernel.c(1604): Inter-Process 
Session Cache: request=SET status=OK 
id=283D4EFA2DE4C4803113F7A9C83A30E818790C684081FEB3669E0DCBC367180B 
timeout=300s (session caching)
[Mon Jan 20 17:51:48 2003] [debug] ssl_engine_kernel.c(1762): OpenSSL: 
Handshake: done
[Mon Jan 20 17:51:48 2003] [info] Connection: Client IP: 198.138.213.34, 
Protocol: SSLv3, Cipher: RC4-MD5 (128/128 bits)
[Mon Jan 20 17:51:48 2003] [debug] ssl_engine_io.c(1488): OpenSSL: I/O error, 5 
bytes expected to read on BIO#8177c88 [mem: 817f318]
[Mon Jan 20 17:51:48 2003] [info] (70014)End of file found: SSL input filter 
read failed.
[Mon Jan 20 17:51:48 2003] [debug] ssl_engine_kernel.c(1776): OpenSSL: Write: 
SSL negotiation finished successfully
[Mon Jan 20 17:51:48 2003] [info] Connection to child 0 closed with standard 
shutdown(server se-ltd.com:443, client 198.138.213.34)

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text:
Kenneth, you mentioned you are seeing the same behavior with 2.0.44.
  What SSLSessionCache option had you selected, and does changing the
  SSLSessionCache between file, shm and none make any difference?

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text: One more point to verify, which version of OpenSSL did you build against?

creator: Kenneth.Lerman@se-ltd.com
text:
Well, I found the problem.

It appears that the certificate and/or key I was using was NG, or missing, or 
not the right file type, or something.

I changed to a known good cert/key and it worked.

Is there some way I could have discovered this from the logs or something?

Thanks for the help -- sorry if I wasted your time.

Ken

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text:
Take a look in your error_log file for the error.  If there was no error,
  and you don't mind sharing that *broken* key/cert pair privately, feel free
  to email and I'll try to track down why it wasn't noted by mod_ssl.
